page.title: 19SUPERNATURAL IN MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: The strangest event recorded in the area occurred at Christmas,1693,when 'unearthly fires rose from the sandy bog',moved across the sea to the Harlech area,set fire to haystacks and killed many farm animals.It was 'a kind of hot mist with a small blue flame'and did not affect humans.It happened only at night and usually on Saturdays and Sundays.Loud noises from horns,drums and guns were found to disperse the fires.Witchcraft was suspected and a man arrested,but he escaped while being taken to a magistrate.Pennant,the historian, thought the fires were caused by the drowned bodies of a flight of locusts.
